NA64-d-11-22-90-SOO.Narrative: THE 1600 ENDERLIN ROAD SWITCHER WITH ENGINE CONSIST 2035-2016-4404-4599-4401 AND 48 LOADS, ONE EMPTY, 5,791 TONS WAS MAKING A REVERSE MOVEMENT AT MP 256.0 AT ENDERLIN, ND., INTENDING TO YARD ITS TRAINBY SHOVING IN TO THE RIP TRACK, BUT THE SWITCH WAS LINED WRONG AND SHOVED INTO THE ROUNDHOUSE LEADWHERE THERE WAS CARS STANDING. THE DRAWBARS BY-PASSED CAUSING THE CABOOSE AND THE LOAD CEMENT TO DERAIL. THIS MISHAP WAS DUE TO HUMAN ERROR. THE CONDUCTOR WAS WATCHING THE SHOVE FROM THE GROUND AND NOT RIDING THE CAR. CONDUCTOR SUBMITTED TO URINE AND BLOOD TESTING UNDER COMPANY POLICY...WITH NO PROBLEMS ENCOUNTERED. TEST RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE. ... CONDUCTOR SIGNED A WAIVER ON 12/7/90, ACCEPTING FULL RESPONSIBILITY AND WAS ASSESSED FIVE DAYS SUSPENSION EFFECTIVE 12/17/90.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

CREW WAS SENT FOR A POST-ACCIDENT DRUG/ALCOHOL TEST AS DAMAGE ESTIMATES AT THE TIME WERE INTHE $750,000 TO $1,000,000 RANGE. THE TEST RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.
